x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.problem_statement:
AI is rapidly transforming industries, but many everyday people that are not tech-savy especially students, small business owners, and rural populations have little understanding of how it works or how to safely use it.
There’s widespread curiosity but also fear, misinformation, and limited access to hands-on learning. Current learning platforms are either too technical, expensive, or disconnected from local realities.
Without localized, simple, and trusted tools to learn about AI, millions risk being left behind in the digital economy.

x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.solution_proposal:
How do you envision the ideal solution to this  problem?

 

Which ServiceNow products or capabilities would be used?

App Engine / Studio: to build personalized learning profiles, progress tracking, and feedback workflows.

Virtual Agent: acts as the friendly AI coach — chatting in English or local languages, guiding users through lessons.

AI Search / Predictive Intelligence: recommends learning topics based on user interests or performance (e.g., “learn AI for business,” “AI and farming”).

Service Portal / Experience Sites: hosts interactive lessons, gamified quizzes, and video explainers.

Flow Designer: automates lesson unlocks, reminders, and certification workflows.

Mobile App: ensures users can learn offline or on low data, with downloadable modules.

Performance Analytics: tracks literacy growth metrics by region, language, and demographics — useful for policymakers and NGOs.

 

Are there any technical dependencies for the proposed solution?

Language APIs: for translation and text-to-speech in major local languages.

IntegrationHub: to connect with open educational content (e.g., Khan Academy, YouTube Education).

AI Models: lightweight NLP models fine-tuned for conversational coaching and assessment.

SMS/USSD Support: for rural users without smartphones or internet access.

Voice Recognition Integration: for users who prefer speaking to typing.

 

What challenges would you foresee in implementing this idea?

Localization: creating culturally and linguistically relevant content.

Adoption: convincing users that AI can be beneficial, not just complex or threatening.

Connectivity: reaching low-bandwidth areas and offline learners.

Trust: ensuring user data and interactions remain private and secure.

Partnerships: securing collaboration from schools, NGOs, and telecoms for wider reach.
